title: Futuristic ghost city for 35,000 people is being built in the desert, but no-one will ever live there
text:
In the New Mexico desert , a plan is underway to build a futuristic city capable of homing up to 35,000 people.
There will be a downtown business district, rows of suburban houses, parks, a shopping mall and a church.
But no-one will ever live there.
Instead, this $1 billion ghost town is being constructed by a giant telecommunications company simply for experimenting with new technology.
CITE
It's called a CITE (Center for Innovation, Testing and Evaluation) project and will cover 15 square miles of land.
"The vision is an environment where new products, services and technologies can be demonstrated and tested without disrupting everyday life," explained Robert Brumley, managing director of Pegasus Global holdings, the company behind the project.
Driverless cars could patrol the roads whilst alternative energy sources are tested large-scale to power the homes.
CITE
What's more, this deserted utopia could be ready as soon as 2018.
"You can bring new things to have them stressed, break them, and find out the laws of unintended consequences," said Brumley.
"This should become like a magnet where people with ideas and technologies come, and not just test but interact."
CITE
Pegasus Global says it expects plenty of clients to show interest in using the facility, from government departments and academic institutions to modern technology companies.
"The facility is open to anybody who wants to test," said Brumley. "That makes it unique."
